column1: Kaduqli or Kadugli (Arabic: كادوقلي‎ Kādūqlī  Sudanese pronunciation: [kaːˈduɢli]) is the capital city of South Kordofan State
column2: Sudan. It is located 240 kilometres (150 mi) south of El-Obeid
column3: at the northern edge of the White Nile plain in the Nuba Mountains. It contains Hilal Stadium.

column1: It is  a trading centre for gum arabic and livestock. Industries include textiles
column3: and the production of leather. Kaduqli is also the Headquarters of Sector IV of the UNMIS (United Nations Mission in Sudan). The sector IV HQ houses the Egyptian Contingent and also includes the Indian Aviation Contingent

column1: Kaduqli has a hot semi-arid climate (Köppen climate classification BSh).
